tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Respected (1)
comments: Hard class that moves quickly, but covers a lot of material. Class can go fast but Williams is good about answering questions office hours.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Respected (1)
stu_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS  LOTS OF HOMEWORK  RESPECTED
comments: Clearly very intelligent and extremely well organized. I feel most students would benefit if he spent more time explaining, however this class is obviously intended for high caliber students, and apparent in the way he teaches.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Respected (1)
comments: I hated going to his class. The homework and lectures sucked. He laughs at his own jokes when no one else does. E.g. "Professor, what material can we expect to be covered on the exam?" "Macroeconomics LOLOLOL". Absolute nightmare, professor. Avoid if possible.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Respected (1)
comments: Noah Williams successfully made econ 312 the worst class I\'ve ever taken. Reads slides in a drone, reuses old hws, annoyed at questions, does not work through problems, makes exams that test algebra more than economics. In short: boring and useless. It\'s not difficult, but you don\'t have to learn anything to do well. Just regurgitate.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Respected (1)
comments: Difficult but if you work hard you will get something out of it.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Respected (1)
comments: Expect to stay up late doing problem sets. Grading is lenient but this material is tough and attending lecture is honestly about as helpful as reading the notes he posts online.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Respected (1)
comments: If you take this course seriously, you can learn a lot. Some of the economics covered in this course is quite advanced, and often times he skips over some details. The homework problems are challenging (but rewarding), and the exams are fair. The power points are confusing, which makes studying for exams confusing and frustrating at times.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Respected (1)
comments: There are lots of bad professors, but usually they don\'t teach the honors sections. Williams reads power points. 90% of lecture is spent rambling over macro graphs. As for the math & concepts, which you\'ll be tested on, Wiliams mumbles something about it, waves his hands & flaps his arms & goes to the next slide, which will be another GDP graph.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Respected (1)
comments: First test was a nightmare, but they got easier after that. Problem sets were graded very fairly. He realizes that you chose to take an honors course, and gave an extremely generous curve. I believe he mentioned average grade was an AB. Very intelligent, sometimes a rather dry lecturer but very helpful overall.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Respected (1)
comments: He\'s a nice guy, and I think cares about the students. He\'s also apparently pretty popular as a researcher and economist. Teaching is not his forte, and in the end the students suffer for it.
